page.title: 04Local History
page.content:
The water mill was built in 1165 and the money from the mill was given to the white Friar monks at Blanchland.It was ruined many times by raiders from across the border.Then in 1910 William Strachan used the power to drive machines and a dynamo for electricity. In 1975 it was converted to a private house.
The Wellington Hotel was built in 1660. It was first used as a house for the people who owned the mill. It was changed into a hotel in 1825.
The Pack Horse Bridge was built in the sixteenth century for the horses taking the corn to the mill, because it was difficult to ford the burn when it was in flood.
